body:
BTW here's a little example of some nested navigations then assertions along with the generated output:
https://github.com/fabric8io/fabric8/issues/5925#issuecomment-208407579

I really like the idea.

I recently created a quick prototype (https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/pull/631) that is a bit similar and that would allow to navigate from a list to its size and back: 

``` java
List<Integer> ints = Arrays.asList(1, 2, 3);
assertThat(ints).size().isGreaterThan(0).isLessThanOrEqualTo(3).returnToList().contains(1).doesNotContain(4);
```

Of course for generated assertions on domain classes this seems even more useful.

Yeah, I love the size() method on ListAssert! It'd be nice to have first(),
last() and item(index) too! Though it would need to know the assertion type
of the elementType of the List-<T>.

Doing something similar to allow navigation to a Map size() or entry would
be great too!

On Monday, 11 April 2016, Pascal Schumacher notifications@github.com
wrote:

> I really like the idea.
> 
> I recently created a quick prototype (joel-costigliola/assertj-core#631
> https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/pull/631) that is a
> bit similar and that would allow to navigate from a list to its size and
> back:
> 
> List<Integer> ints = Arrays.asList(1, 2, 3);
> assertThat(ints).size().isGreaterThan(0).isLessThanOrEqualTo(3).returnToList().contains(1).doesNotContain(4);
> 
> Of course for generated assertions on domain classes this seems even more
> useful.
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-assertions-generator/issues/67#issuecomment-208469038

## 

## James

Red Hat

Twitter: @jstrachan
Email: james.strachan@gmail.com
Medium: https://medium.com/@jstrachan/
Blog: http://macstrac.blogspot.com/

fabric8: http:/ http://fusesource.com//fabric8.io/
hawtio: http:/ http://fusesource.com//hawt.io/

Open Source DevOps and Integration

Yeah element assertions would be great, but I believe type-erasure makes that impossible.

I think the closest we can get to that with java 8 is something like: `assertThat(jedis).hasOnlyOneElementMatching(jedi -> jedi.name.equals("Yo! da"));`
(taken form https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/issues/518)

BTW here's the template I use to generate the nested navigations:
https://github.com/jstrachan/fabric8/blob/5f99b82696856e9c5614ff5a728adfbeaab96751/components/kubernetes-assertions/src/main/assertj-templates/navigation_template.txt

I had to override the abstract class template so that I could add a few imports too - it might be nice one day to make that easier to parameterise maybe:
https://github.com/jstrachan/fabric8/blob/5f99b82696856e9c5614ff5a728adfbeaab96751/components/kubernetes-assertions/src/main/assertj-templates/custom_abstract_assertion_class_template.txt#L11
I like the idea, I'll review the PR in the next few weeks.

issue.title: add a NavigationListAssert<T,EA> extends ListAssert<T> for easier navigation through generated Assert models

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
this is an implementation class used to provide generated navigation methods through generated Assert classes. 

For background see this whole thread for https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-assertions-generator/issues/67

In particular for [here's an example navigating through lists](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-assertions-generator/issues/67#issuecomment-208756239)

So these classes are really intended to be reused by folks generating assertion classes using navigable list properties.

PR on its way shortly...

body:
@jstrachan awesome, the error message examples are great :+1:

I guess there is also a helpful error message when some element of the "path" is null?

BTW I've submitted a PR for the NavigationListAssert class (the main implementation behind the list based navigations) here so its available in the assertj-core:
https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/issues/641

or it can be used stand alone too (though its a little more clumsy to use):
https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/issues/641#issuecomment-208830787

issue.title: switch the property/field templates over to use the 'navigation' approach by default?
issue.body:
Once this PR is merged and issue fixed https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-assertions-generator/issues/67 along with the NavigationListAssert class in assertj-core: https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/issues/641 it would be easy to switch the OOTB templates in the generator to use the 'navigation' model approach. 

So that for every property of an object we generate exactly one navigation method that lets users chain assertions together; reusing all the methods from ListAssert and NavigationListAssert for iterable properties or the custom typed assertions for other properties. 

This would result in much smaller code generated for the assertion classes and much more power. The only downside is some of the current methods would be a tad more verbose. 

e.g. for a generated assertion class with a name property the current generated code would be:

``` java
// current generated code
assertThat(person).hasName("James");

// new minimal code
assertThat(person).name().isEqualTo("James");
assertThat(person).name().contains("m");
...
```

Ditto for iterable properties right now we generate a few methods which are mostly already included in ListAssert. e.g. all these assertion methods are available on any generated iterable property method:
https://github.com/jstrachan/assertj-core/blob/7b1d079edeb5ac984cebbed77a65025718ee7673/src/test/java/org/assertj/core/navigation/ListNavigation_Test.java#L56-L62

Removing the old generated methods would break folks code I guess; so maybe we should add a flag to switch to the new more concise model?

If you are interested; here are the 2 new templates (which need minor tweaks to reuse the https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/issues/641 code):
- for general properties/fields: https://github.com/jstrachan/fabric8/blob/5f99b82696856e9c5614ff5a728adfbeaab96751/components/kubernetes-assertions/src/main/assertj-templates/navigation_template.txt
- for iterable properties/fields: https://github.com/jstrachan/fabric8/blob/6e333451afceec3308e6869f39a14c3e569d837b/components/kubernetes-assertions/src/main/assertj-templates/has_elements_assertion_template_for_iterable.txt
